segment.source: Prerequisites for MBAM 2.5 Clients
segment.target: Prerequisites for MBAM 2.5 Clients

segment.source: Prerequisites for MBAM 2.5 Clients
segment.target: Prerequisites for MBAM 2.5 Clients

segment.source: Prerequisites for MBAM 2.5 Clients
segment.target: Prerequisites for MBAM 2.5 Clients

segment.source: Before you install the MBAM Client software on end users' computers, ensure that your environment and the client computers meet the following prerequisites.
segment.target: Before you install the MBAM Client software on end users' computers, ensure that your environment and the client computers meet the following prerequisites.

segment.source: Prerequisite
segment.target: Prerequisite

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: The enterprise domain must contain at least one Windows Server 2008 (or later) domain controller.
segment.target: The enterprise domain must contain at least one Windows Server 2008 (or later) domain controller.

segment.source: The client computer must be logged on to the enterprise intranet.
segment.target: The client computer must be logged on to the enterprise intranet.

segment.source: For Windows 7 client computers only: Each client must have Trusted Platform Module (TPM) capability (TPM 1.2 or later).
segment.target: For Windows 7 client computers only: Each client must have Trusted Platform Module (TPM) capability (TPM 1.2 or later).

segment.source: For Windows 8 and Windows 8.1 client computers only: If you want MBAM to be able to store and manage the TPM recovery keys, TPM auto-provisioning must be turned off, and MBAM must be set as the owner of the TPM before you deploy MBAM.
segment.target: For Windows 8 and Windows 8.1 client computers only: If you want MBAM to be able to store and manage the TPM recovery keys, TPM auto-provisioning must be turned off, and MBAM must be set as the owner of the TPM before you deploy MBAM.

segment.source: In MBAM 2.5 SP1 only, you no longer need to turn off TPM auto-provisioning, but you must make sure that the TPM Group Policy Objects are set to not escrow TPM OwnerAuth to Active Directory.
segment.target: In MBAM 2.5 SP1 only, you no longer need to turn off TPM auto-provisioning, but you must make sure that the TPM Group Policy Objects are set to not escrow TPM OwnerAuth to Active Directory.

segment.source: MBAM 2.5 Security Considerations
segment.target: MBAM 2.5 Security Considerations

segment.source: The TPM chip must be turned on in the BIOS and be resettable from the operating system.
segment.target: The TPM chip must be turned on in the BIOS and be resettable from the operating system.

segment.source: See the BIOS documentation for more information.
segment.target: See the BIOS documentation for more information.

segment.source: The computer’s hard disk must have at least two partitions and must be formatted with the NTFS file system.
segment.target: The computer’s hard disk must have at least two partitions and must be formatted with the NTFS file system.

segment.source: The computer’s hard disk must have a BIOS that is compatible with TPM and that supports USB devices during computer startup.
segment.target: The computer’s hard disk must have a BIOS that is compatible with TPM and that supports USB devices during computer startup.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Ensure that the keyboard, video, or mouse are directly connected and not managed through a keyboard, video, or mouse (KVM) switch.
segment.target: Ensure that the keyboard, video, or mouse are directly connected and not managed through a keyboard, video, or mouse (KVM) switch.

segment.source: A KVM switch can interfere with the ability of the computer to detect the physical presence of hardware.
segment.target: A KVM switch can interfere with the ability of the computer to detect the physical presence of hardware.

segment.source: If you use a proxy, it must be visible in the system context.
segment.target: If you use a proxy, it must be visible in the system context.

segment.source: MBAM runs under the system context, not the user context.
segment.target: MBAM runs under the system context, not the user context.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If BitLocker was used without MBAM, you must decrypt the drive and then clear TPM using tpm.msc.
segment.target: If BitLocker was used without MBAM, you must decrypt the drive and then clear TPM using tpm.msc.

segment.source: MBAM cannot take ownership of TPM if the client PC is already encrypted and the TPM owner password created.
segment.target: MBAM cannot take ownership of TPM if the client PC is already encrypted and the TPM owner password created.

segment.source: Got a suggestion for MBAM?
segment.target: Got a suggestion for MBAM?

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: For MBAM issues, use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
segment.target: For MBAM issues, use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
